definitions.definition: To verbally attack or criticise.
definitions.example: The teacher ripped into Johnny when he found out he had plagiarised.

definitions.definition: To start to eat something.
definitions.example: Dinner's ready. Rip into it!

definitions.definition: To communicate with a base etc, by telephone.
definitions.example: I was too unwell to work yesterday so I called in sick.

definitions.definition: To report; communicate (a message) by telephone or similar.
definitions.example: The hoaxer called in a bomb threat.

definitions.definition: To pay a short visit.
definitions.example: I'll call in this afternoon to pick up my prescription.

definitions.definition: To summon someone, especially for help or advice.
definitions.example: The government called in the army to deal with the riots.

definitions.definition: To withdraw something from sale or circulation.

Someone who violates an allegiance and betrays their country; someone guilty of treason; one who, in breach of trust, delivers their country to an enemy, or yields up any fort or place entrusted to his defense, or surrenders an army or body of troops to the enemy, unless when vanquished
Someone who takes arms and levies war against their country; or one who aids an enemy in conquering his country.
Hence, one who betrays any confidence or trust.
To act the traitor toward; to betray; to deceive.
Traitorous
A railway gauge (distance between the two lines) that is less than the standard gauge (often quoted as 56 inches)
A facility which sells fuel and lubricants for motor vehicles.
A player who plays on the left or right side of defence.
The player who wears the number 15 jersey at the start of play. The last line of defence responsible for catching punts.
An offensive back whose primary jobs are to block in advance of the halfback on running plays and for the quarterback on passing plays.
A position behind the main line of backs in both rugby union and rugby league.
A defensive player who assists the goalie in preventing the opposing team from scoring.
A member of a Christian religious community of women who live by certain vows and usually wear a habit, (specifically) those living together in a cloister.
(by extension) A member of a similar female community in other confessions.
A prostitute.
A kind of pigeon with the feathers on its head like the hood of a nun.
The fourteenth letter of many Semitic alphabets/abjads (Phoenician, Aramaic, Hebrew, Syriac, Arabic and others).
A person who robs.
A small ornament of minor value.
A bachelorette party; a party held for a woman who is about to be married.
Makeup for the lips.
definitions.example: Are you wearing any lipstick today?

definitions.definition: A stick of this make-up.
definitions.example: I'd like three lipsticks in this shade.

definitions.definition: To apply lipstick to; to paint with lipstick.
A genre of fiction, especially film, that presents love stories in a humorous and light-hearted way.
Such a story.
Needs for special care, services or accommodations for disabilities.
definitions.example: The school has introduced provisions for pupils with special needs.

definitions.definition: A style of English rock music from the early 1970s, distinguished by the glamorous, glittery costumes of its performers and its bouncy beat and lyrics.
A disease spread by contact
The spread or transmission of such a disease
(by extension) the spread of anything harmful, as if it were such a disease

A situation in which small shocks, which initially affect only a few financial institutions or a particular region of an economy, spread to the rest of financial sectors and other countries whose economies were previously healthy
A resulting recession or crisis developed in such manner

A repetitive style of music originally produced for use in a continuous DJ set. The central rhythmic component is most often in common time (4/4), where time is marked with a bass drum on each quarter note pulse, a backbeat played by snare or clap on the second and fourth pulses of the bar, and an open hi-hat sounding every second eighth note.
A person who makes and repairs shoes
A person who lays cobbles; a roadworker
A kind of pie, usually filled with fruit, that lacks a crust at the base
(usually in the plural) A police officer
definitions.example: Look out: it's the cobblers!.

definitions.definition: An alcoholic drink containing spirit or wine, with sugar and lemon juice
A clumsy workman
The fastest gait of a horse, a two-beat stride during which all four legs are off the ground simultaneously.
An abnormal rhythm of the heart, made up of three or four sounds, like a horse's gallop.
(of a horse, etc) To run at a gallop.
definitions.example: The horse galloped past the finishing line.

definitions.definition: To ride at a galloping pace.
To cause to gallop.
definitions.example: to gallop a horse

definitions.definition: To make electrical or other utility lines sway and/or move up and down violently, usually due to a combination of high winds and ice accrual on the lines.
To run very fast.
To go rapidly or carelessly, as in making a hasty examination.
(of an infection, especially pneumonia) To progress rapidly through the body.
A person who broils, someone who cooks by broiling.
A device used to broil food; part of an oven or a small stove; known as a grill in UK English.
A chicken suitable for broiling.
One who excites broils; one who engages in or promotes noisy quarrels.
The act or process of ratifying, or the state of being ratified.
A formal declaration of agreement to a treaty etc.
(of a vehicle) To accelerate so rapidly from standstill that it leaves a mark of burnt rubber on the road from the tire.
A greasy or waxy substance that is used to style hair, making it look slick and shiny.
Any medicinal ointment.
To anoint with pomade; to use pomade to style (hair).
definitions.example: He pomaded his hair until it looked like a piece of shiny plastic.

definitions.definition: The scientific study of plants, a branch of biology. Typically those disciplines that involve the whole plant.
The plant life of a geographical area; flora.
definitions.example: the botany of Greenland

definitions.definition: The properties and life phenomena exhibited by a plant, plant type, or plant group.
A botanical treatise or study, especially of a particular system of botany or that of a particular place.
The inhalation of tobacco smoke by a non-smoker due to proximity to smokers.
In a brilliant manner; with brilliance.
A convoy or procession of travelers, their vehicles and cargo, and any pack animals, especially camels crossing a desert.
A furnished vehicle towed behind a car, etc., and used as a dwelling when stationary.
To travel in a caravan (procession).
definitions.example: The wedding party got in their cars and caravaned from the chapel to the reception hall.

definitions.definition: To travel and/or live in a caravan (vehicle).
definitions.example: When my parents retired they really got back into caravanning.

definitions.definition: The amount (of cargo) that a ship can carry.
The event of small airborne particles falling to the ground in significant quantities as a result of major industrial activity, volcano eruption, sandstorm, nuclear explosion, etc.
The particles themselves.
definitions.example: On 26 April 1986 the reactor number four at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant located in the Soviet Union near Pripyat in Ukraine exploded. Further explosions and the resulting fire sent a plume of highly radioactive fallout into the atmosphere and over an extensive geographical area.

definitions.definition: A negative side effect; an undesirable or unexpected consequence.
definitions.example: Psychological fallout in the shadow of terrorism, title of an article by Dr. Abraham Twerski, M.D. in http//www.jewishworldreview.com.

definitions.definition: A declined offer in a sales transaction when acceptance was presumed.
The person who declines such an offer.
An impromptu guest used to fill in for another guest spot who is a no show or who has cancelled last minute
Part of the sea by a beach sectioned off for swimming and other aquatic activities.
An outdoor swimming pool.
Singular of economies of scale
A friend or date whom one brings along to an event; a guest of a guest.
The period during which a novice of a religious order undergoes training
The place where a novice lives and studies
A novice
The part of an internal combustion engine which forms a high-voltage electric spark which ignites the fuel-air mixture to begin the power stroke.
Someone who is a driving force in new endeavours.
Any of various venomous snakes, of the subfamily Crotalinae, found in Asia and the Americas, with a deep pit or fossa on either side of the head that enables them to detect prey by infrared.
An intervening episode, etc.
An entertainment between the acts of a play.
A short piece put between the parts of a longer composition.
To provide with an interlude.
A racetrack with optimum conditions for high speeds
A railroad for express trains.
The quickest or most direct method or path.
definitions.example: Google welcomes the decision to not approve the fast track of Microsoft's OOXML.

definitions.definition: A high-pressure or intensely competitive situation, particularly one characterised by rapid advancement.
To progress something with unusual rapidity.
definitions.example: The head of Sydney Airport thinks frequent flyers should be fast-tracked through security checks.

definitions.definition: An acknowledgement of a hit.
An acknowledgement of the validity, appropriateness or superiority of an opponent's argument or statement in a discussion.

An individual trained to medically stabilize people through various interventions, victims of trauma or medical events outside of a hospital setting and preparing them for transport to a medical facility.
An individual who is licensed at the state or national level to practice medical interventions in an emergency pre-hospital setting.
Of or relating to the provision of emergency medical treatment
Of or relating to a paramedic
Something that is compatible with something else.
definitions.example: a computer company that sells IBM compatibles

definitions.definition: Capable of easy interaction.
definitions.example: This printer isn't compatible with my computer.

definitions.definition: Able to get along well.
definitions.example: My neighbours and I are not very compatible: they're loud and I'm an introvert.

definitions.definition: Consistent; congruous.
definitions.example: His actions were compatible with his sermons.

definitions.definition: The act and skills of presenting stories and tales.
A regular polyhedron having six identical square faces.
Any object more or less in the form of a cube.
definitions.example: a stock cube

definitions.definition: The third power of a number, value, term or expression.
definitions.example: the cube of 2 is 8

definitions.definition: A data structure consisting of a three-dimensional array; a data cube
A Rubick's cube style puzzle, not necessarily in the shape of a cube
To raise to the third power; to determine the result of multiplying by itself twice.
definitions.example: Three cubed can be written as 33, and equals twenty-seven.

definitions.definition: To form into the shape of a cube.
To cut into cubes.
definitions.example: Cube the ham right after adding the curry to the rice.

definitions.definition: To use a Rubik's cube.
definitions.example: He likes to cube now and then.

definitions.definition: A cubicle, especially one of those found in offices.
definitions.example: My co-worker annoys me by throwing things over the walls of my cube.

definitions.definition: A document issued by a medical practitioner, or by a registrar, certifying the date, location and cause of a person's death as later entered in an official register of deaths.
The eldest child in a family, or individual in a group.
(of a player) Receiving cards from the dealer first, before any other players.
(of a hand) Having higher, or superior cards.
Of an object, concept, relationship, etc., having existed for a relatively long period of time.
definitions.example: an old abandoned building;  an old friend

definitions.definition: Having been used and thus no longer new or unused.
definitions.example: I find that an old toothbrush is good to clean the keyboard with.

definitions.definition: Having existed or lived for the specified time.
definitions.example: How old are they? She’s five years old and he's seven. We also have a young teen and a two-year-old child.

definitions.definition: (heading) Of an earlier time.
Tiresome after prolonged repetition.
definitions.example: Your constant pestering is getting old.

definitions.definition: Said of subdued colors, particularly reds, pinks and oranges, as if they had faded over time.
A grammatical intensifier, often used in describing something positive. (Mostly in idioms like good old, big old and little old, any old and some old.)
definitions.example: We're having a good old time. My next car will be a big old SUV.  My wife makes the best little old apple pie in Texas.

definitions.definition: Excessive, abundant.
A rift between people or groups, often following a disagreement or quarrel
definitions.example: Since the falling out with his neighbor, they have kept their distance.

definitions.definition: A culture-bound syndrome primarily reported in the southern United States and the Caribbean, described as a constricted consciousness as a psychological response to anxiety and stress.
The state of being stubborn.
definitions.example:
What is stubbornness? It is not only refusing to believe a crucial message, but also shunning or at least looking down on those, who stated or believed it in the first place.
Perhaps only when it's too late for regrets will that person understand.

definitions.definition: The act or practice of exhorting; the act of inciting to laudable deeds; incitement to that which is good or commendable.
Language intended to incite and encourage
An auditorium for concerts and musical entertainments.
A vaudeville or variety theater.
(chiefly in the plural) a writing system of ancient Egypt, Minoans, Maya and other civilizations, using pictorial symbols to represent individual sounds as a rebus
Any symbol used in this system; a hieroglyph
(by extension) undecipherable handwriting or secret symbol
That reflects, or redirects back to the source.
definitions.example: Mirrors are reflective.

definitions.definition: Pondering, especially thinking back on the past.
definitions.example: He always becomes reflective in preparation for the new year.

definitions.definition: That reveals or shows; revealing; indicative of.
Involving reflection.
(grammar) Reciprocal.
(grammar) A reflexive pronoun.
(grammar) A reflexive verb.
(grammar) Referring back to the subject, or having an object equal to the subject.
Of a relation R on a set S, such that xRx for all members x of S (that is, the relation holds between any element of the set and itself).
definitions.example: "Equals" is a reflexive relation.

definitions.definition: Of or resulting from a reflex.
definitions.example: The electric shock elicited an automatic and reflexive response from him.

definitions.definition: Producing immediate response, spontaneous.
definitions.example: a reflexive dislike

definitions.definition: A woman whose occupation it is to sell things.
(often in the plural) Something which is done or is to be done; business of any kind, commercial, professional, or public.
definitions.example: a difficult affair to manage

definitions.definition: Any proceeding or action which it is wished to refer to or characterize vaguely.
definitions.example: an affair of honor, a duel;  an affair of love, an intrigue

definitions.definition: An action or engagement not of sufficient magnitude to be called a battle.
A material object (vaguely designated).
definitions.example: He used a hook-shaped affair with a long handle to unlock the car.

definitions.definition: An adulterous relationship. (from affaire de cœur).
A romantic relationship with someone who is not one's regular partner (boyfriend, girlfriend).
A person with whom someone has an adulterous relationship.
A party or social gathering, especially of a formal nature.
The (male or female) genitals.
To eviscerate.
definitions.example: The fisherman guts the fish before cooking them.

definitions.definition: To remove or destroy the most important parts of.
definitions.example: Congress gutted the welfare bill.

definitions.definition: Eviscerated.
With the most important parts destroyed (often by fire), removed or rendered useless.
Having a gut or guts.
Deeply disappointed; annoyed; down.
The power unit of a train that pulls the coaches or wagons.
A traction engine
A cheer characterized by a slow beginning and a progressive increase in speed
A country which drives the world economy by having a high level of imports. (i.e. The United States).
Of or relating to locomotion
Of or relating to the power unit of a train which does not carry passengers or freight itself
Having buoyancy; able to float.
Lighthearted and lively.
definitions.example: I’m in a buoyant mood.

definitions.definition: A brass instrument resembling a cornet but with a wider, conical bore, and usually with three valves, in the same B-flat pitch as many trumpets and cornets but with a more deeply conical mouthpiece than those. A bugle with valves.
A secondary road; a road that is not intended for heavy traffic.
definitions.example: The office was on a mostly residential side street. It did not look professional, and for a moment he doubted he was in the right place.

definitions.definition: The primary income-earner in a household.
One who teaches another (usually called a student, learner, or tutee) in a one-on-one or small-group interaction.
definitions.example: He passed the difficult class with help from his tutor.

definitions.definition: A university officer responsible for students in a particular hall.
One who has the charge of a child or pupil and his estate; a guardian.
(trading card games) A card that allows you to search your deck for one or more other cards.
To instruct or teach, especially an individual or small group.
definitions.example: To help pay her tuition, the college student began to tutor high school students in calculus and physics.

definitions.definition: To treat with authority or sternness.
Any straight line between two points on the circumference of a circle that passes through the centre/center of the circle.
The length of such a line.
The maximum distance between any two points in a metric space
The maximum eccentricity over all vertices in a graph.
For a number x, the power to which a given base number must be raised in order to obtain x. Written \log_b x. For example, \log_{10} 1000 = 3 because 10^3 = 1000 and \log_2 16 = 4 because 2^4 = 16.
A musical instrument, a shaker, made of a hollow gourd with parallel notches cut in one side, and played by rubbing a stick or scraper ("pua") along the notches to produce a ratchet-like sound.
A genre of traditional Cuban music, used in santería rituals.
A musical instrument consisting of a gourd surrounded by a net of beads.
definitions.example: The sekere may be twisted, shaken or slapped to produce a subtle variety of effects.

definitions.definition: An argument that is opposed to another argument.
Any member of the taxonomic class Asteroidea; a starfish
A naturally occurring solid object, which is smaller than a planet and is not a comet, that orbits a star
In the Solar system, such a body that orbits within the orbit of Jupiter
A migratory passerine bird of the swallow family, Riparia riparia.
Any of various wading birds of the genera Egretta or Ardea that includes herons, many of which are white or buff, and several of which develop fine plumes during the breeding season.
A plume or tuft of feathers worn as a part of a headdress, or anything imitating such an ornament.
The flying feathery or hairy crown of seeds or achenes, such as the down of the thistle.
The crab-eating macaque (Macaca fascicularis)
Of or relating to the ancient Greek philosopher Plato or his philosophies.
Neither sexual nor romantic in nature; being or exhibiting platonic love.
definitions.example: They are good friends, but their relationship is strictly platonic.

definitions.definition: One who rows.
A rowing machine.
The area around a farm, excluding the fields.
A deep narrow valley or gorge in the earth's surface worn by running water.
Rapine; rapacity.
Prey; plunder; food obtained by violence.

The lower levels of the atmosphere extending from the surface of the Earth or another celestial body up to the tropopause. It is characterized by convective air movements and a large vertical temperature change.
Any of several fibrous mineral forms of magnesium silicate, used for fireproofing, electrical insulation, building materials, brake linings, chemical filters, suits, fireman's gloves, etc.
definitions.example: All types of asbestos are potentially carcinogenic when inhaled.

definitions.definition: Any of asbestos-like forms of several minerals, asbestiforms
A protruding belly caused by excess fat stored in the abdomen and attributed to the consumption of beer.
Not seeded (in any sense).
Not being a seed, not being in a seed position.
A cross shaped like a T with a loop at the top, the Egyptian hieroglyph representing the Egyptian triliteral ꜥnḫ and often used as an amulet or charm for this concept.
Tau cross
A small horse-drawn cart.
A small motor vehicle, such as a dune buggy.
A hearse.
A pushchair; a stroller.
A shopping cart or trolley.
Infested with insects
Containing programming errors
definitions.example: This software is so buggy that I don't know how anyone can use it!

definitions.definition: Resembling an insect
Crazy; bughouse
The act of lurking.
A swindle.
To remain concealed in order to ambush.
To remain unobserved.
To hang out or wait around a location, preferably without drawing attention to oneself.
To view an internet forum without posting comments.
To saddle (a person) with an undesirable task or duty.
A writer or publisher of pamphlets, a second-rate journalist
To publish and distribute pamphlets as a form of propaganda.
Twisted strands of steel wire, often coated with zinc, having barbs evenly spaced along them; used to construct agricultural and military fences.
(physical) Matter, material.
A large quantity; a sum.
To form or collect into a mass; to form into a collective body; to bring together into masses; to assemble.
To have a certain mass.
definitions.example: I mass 70 kilograms.

definitions.definition: Involving a mass of things; concerning a large quantity or number.
definitions.example: There is evidence of mass extinctions in the distant past.

definitions.definition: Involving a mass of people; of, for, or by the masses.
definitions.example: Mass unemployment resulted from the financial collapse.

definitions.definition: The Eucharist, now especially in Roman Catholicism.
Celebration of the Eucharist.
(usually as the Mass) The sacrament of the Eucharist.
A musical setting of parts of the mass.
To celebrate mass.
A marriage motivated by some reason other than love; especially one conducted to obtain entry or residence rights in a country.
